Billy Moore.Action: Peers cautiously through a crack in a wall to observe a larger, intimidating Muay Thai boxer training, indicating awareness and situational assessment.
Uses and inhales crack cocaine (YABA) immediately before observing training, potentially impairing judgment and physical performance.
Pounds a cement post with his bare fist to temper his nerves and not feel.
Slams a board against his shins repeatedly, numbing himself through pain.
Paces anxiously, takes deep breaths, prepares himself with trembling hands to fight.
Peers outside to see Eckachai and his trainer leaving; smokes Yaba to calm down.
Nindam helps him put on boxing gloves and ties the gloves; they nod and bump fists afterward.
Avoids Nindam's gaze while being too high and amped during glove tying.
Protests to the referee after the fight ends, trying to communicate frustration despite language barrier.
Headbutts the referee after being shoved violently, reacting with aggression.
Headbutts Ref after Ref violently shoves Nindam away.
Kicks and stomps the Ref with manic, uncontrollable rage despite being restrained by bouncers.
Experiences remorse, self-hatred, and pain after the violent outburst.
Headbutts Ref full in the face with hair trigger fast reaction.
Kicks and stomps the Ref with manic, uncontrollable rage leading to being restrained.
Shows awareness that Papa notices the drugs in his eyes, implying self-awareness of his impaired state.
Internal shift from rage to remorse, self-hatred, and pain, indicative of emotional insight but not action capability.
Moves through chaotic, drugged, disorienting environment with confused, unfocused perception.
Counts out drug packets accurately, handles cash and drugs smoothly in a tense environment.
Hustles deal after deal while increasingly high and intoxicated; losing control due to substance use.
Throws water on face and shadow-boxes in the mirror in an attempt to regain composure.
Attempts to talk to Nina despite rejection and his poor condition, then forcibly pulls her close.
Looks away in shame when the apartment manager stares at him in horror.
Hides yaba packets by swallowing and inserting them forcibly up his body during police raid.
Eruppts loudly demanding the embassy to help, refuses to sign when scared and pressured by police.
Calmly tries to deny accusations (e.g., ‘I bought those’, ‘No’ to drug dealer), showing sincerity and honesty.
Unable to read Thai document, refuses to sign without understanding, demands contact with embassy loudly and firmly.
Looks terrified, frozen amid aggressive interrogation and threats, unable to calm or negotiate effectively.
Steps up to undergo humiliating and demeaning physical examination after witnessing brutality and injustice, showing tolerance and restraint.
Stares in shock at the brutal beating of Nok, indicating empathy and concern.
No one else moves or intervenes during the guard's violent beating, but Billy's inner reaction shows sensitivity, even if no action is taken.
Observes the brutal treatment of a fellow prisoner without intervening.
Steps up calmly to undergo demeaning physical exams despite discomfort.
Accepts heroin offered discreetly by Elyias to ease pain, indicating trust in fellow prisoner.
Remains mostly silent and withdrawn when offered help, showing limited outward friendliness or openness.
Fought for tips rather than professionally, suggesting a humble, unassuming nature.
Refuses to sit near the dead body despite guard's directive, shows sensitivity and respect toward the deceased.
Attempts to assert a boundary to avoid discomfort for himself and perhaps others, despite risk of conflict with the guard.
Tries to assert himself to avoid sitting next to a dead body, attempts to communicate his discomfort and reasoning despite language barrier.
Fails to effectively influence the guard's decision, ends up being thrown down to the floor and forced to sit near the corpse.
Thanks Tiffany after she offers him a cigarette and acknowledges her English skills.
Responds sharply and aggressively to Tiffany's teasing comments and physical proximity.
Asks Tiffany for basic needs (pillow, blanket, food) showing vulnerability and need.
Stands back and watches a heated argument without escalating it, discreetly signals Elyias for help, showing caution and restraint.
Feels nervous and ill at ease but does not lash out or act aggressively; waits patiently despite daunting guards.
Engages in drug use under pressure (cooks and inhales a drug given by Elyias), showing vulnerability but also indicating compromised behavior.
Remains motionless and detached during a violent prison fight, not intervening to help others or defuse conflict.

Observes fellow prisoners silently, noting their suffering and despair without judgment or hostility.
Yells 'Nok!' during the head count, indicating participation or connection with others.
Bites off his own thumbnail and bleeds, engaging in self-harm.
Grips bars on his knees, staring across the yard at the Buddha statue and the boxers going by; stays silent and solemn.
Remains quiet and reserved when confronted with the cell boss barking orders; does not react negatively or aggressively.

Shares honestly and openly with the boxing team about being in prison for drugs, responds with a smile as the team jokes, engaging warmly in the communal moment.
Laughs along with the team at the Thai Boxer's dark humor, showing social engagement and friendliness.
Shares quiet, somber moment with Lek looking at family photos, learns Thai words, demonstrating openness and willingness to connect.
Acknowledges personal pain and fractured relationship with his father when asked by Lek, indicating sincerity and vulnerability.
Pounds the canvas in frustration after being thrown repeatedly, showing determination but also loss of composure.
Does not engage with Kiaw’s cold stare beyond minimal acknowledgment, no escalation or hostility but rather a guarded interaction.
Gets thrown down while sparring but jumps up and re-engages
Pounds the canvas with his fist in frustration after being thrown down again
Repeats Thai phrases accurately when taught by Lek
Pauses thoughtfully before answering about his father
Approaches Kiaw and engages in conversation despite cold stare
Dismisses Kiaw's complaints about the stolen heroin and refuses to pay the debt despite Kiaw's threats.
Silently endures Kiaw's threats without escalating or retaliating aggressively.
Charges to defend Jom from the German Inmate's harassment and threats, using intimidation to protect her.
Dips and lands a powerful hook that stuns his opponent Lek, followed by a barrage of devastating punches leading to Lek being unconscious.
Reacting with shock and quickly attending to the injured Lek, showing awareness and responsibility after intense action.
Storms out of the ring aggressively, ripping off gloves and slamming them, showing emotional loss of control despite physical prowess.
Adapts to harsh punishment cell conditions by maintaining physical discipline through wall pounding, sit-ups, and push-ups, even involving an inmate to continue training.
Rips down prisoners' clothes wire to use as a jump rope.
Helps Noi bathe and dries him off with a towel.
Shaves his own head and eyebrows with a dull razor despite pain and bleeding.
Performs intense shadowboxing with fast, violent combos that intimidate others.
Speaks in Thai for the first time to communicate with Noi.
Shows moments of mental disengagement as his eyes glaze over while jumping rope.
No mention of failed or clumsy behavior in this excerpt.
Offers to buy new flip-flops for Noi when he notices the old ones are not good.
Shares a light moment laughing with Noi and the Old Man over the plastic flower headband, showing humor and friendliness.
Shows sensitivity and emotional openness when silently sharing a moment of connection with Jom.
Inspects items carefully and negotiates the purchase of flip-flops that Noi likes.
Attempts to learn the Ram Muay dance alone despite frustration and stiffness in movements.
Communicates in Thai to offer to buy new shoes for Noi, showing cultural and language skill.
Selects the feminine flower headband with awareness of social context and plays humorously with the old man and Noi.
Gets emotionally affected and silent in the presence of Jom, showing vulnerability instead of confidence.
Both smile during boxing practice, indicating forgiveness and shared effort with Jom.
Bumps gloves with Pon after intense sparring round, showing sportsmanship and respect.
Notices blood on Pon's shoulder but does not react negatively, indicating awareness and restraint.
Attempts to hide concern about his health from Nan, possibly to protect her from worry.
Engages in sparring with Pon, focusing on technique and trying to iron out flaws.
Takes a hard hit to the kidney but reacts aggressively and covers well.
Even while having trouble breathing and bleeding internally, he continues to defend and fight back.
Recognizes something is seriously wrong as blood flecks on Pon but only he notices, showing awareness.
After the round ends, goes immediately to bathroom, locks door, acknowledges fear and vulnerability openly.
Vomit blood violently, indicating severe injury but does not downplay it or push through blindly.
Tries to hide concern from Nan while walking back to cell, possibly failing to communicate vulnerability.
Tries to hide his pain from Nan, doesn't openly share his suffering.
Responds honestly but briefly to Dr. Adi's questions, acknowledges his sobriety and health issues.
Attempts to hide his pain and fear from Nan, showing emotional control under stress.
Engages with Dr. Adi with clear, honest communication about his condition and intentions.
Acknowledges his medical condition but shows a lack of immediate understanding of severity (asks 'A what...?').
Demonstrates practical realism about his situation (recognizing he can't make other plans due to prison).
Insists on returning to training despite medical advice to moderate activity and heal, showing some recklessness.
Refuses to accept doctor's advice to never fight again, insists on keeping his guard up and watching his pace.
Attacks the boxing bag fast, loud, and violent to prove the doctor wrong despite clear medical warnings.
Acknowledges Nan's authority and nods thanks, showing respect and awareness of social dynamics in gym.
Clutches chest and hides pain, indicating he is ignoring his physical limits which could worsen his condition.
Breathes in the cold water, focusing his mind and emotions to reach a calm, concentrated state where fighters go
Instinctively senses danger, turns to identify threats, and freezes momentarily, showing awareness and assessment
Immediately runs through prisoner traffic with heart hammering, showing quick reactive survival instinct
When caught by Kiaw, quickly recovers to stomp hard and escape the grasp
Falls tangled in sheets and becomes vulnerable to Samurai attack, losing physical control and failing to escape
Frozen, wide-eyed, and silent while threatened with infection and extortion, ultimately submits without resistance or negotiation
Prays sincerely with Nan, showing mutual respect before the fight.
Locks eyes with Officer Pi Sit briefly, indicating recognition or possible trust.
Focuses intensely on fight, appearing to rely on his own strength and resilience without showing hostility towards others.
Encourages himself strongly by responding affirmatively and repeatedly to Nan's urging before the final round, showing determination and engagement with supportive others.
Fights with exhaustion and pain, pushing through and showing resilience and commitment, which can inspire empathy and respect from others.
Finds his distance and timing masterfully, chops a hard kick to Diesel's thigh that buckles him.
Pushes himself through severe pain and exhaustion during the fight, fights back fiercely.
Struggles to breathe and has brutally swollen legs, yet continues fighting.
Wraps the sarong around his waist to cover the chains before moving around the hospital.
Carefully taps the elevator button and cautiously steps in without disturbing the chains despite the presence of multiple hospital staff and patients.
Maintains focus on the floor number lights during the elevator descent to control his panic and avoid eye contact.
Freezes momentarily when the elevator door opens and multiple medical staff enter, showing a moment of hesitation in an uncomfortable situation.
Smiles and casually greets the guard in the recovery ward with friendliness despite the situation.
Does not engage in hostility or complaint when being cuffed and taken back to prison; instead, openly admits to a guard he doesn't want to run anymore.
Realizes he wants to live and decisively walks faster toward the hospital, showing determination and a clear shift in mindset.
Appears stunned and caught off guard when Officer Pi Sit asks why he came back, momentarily lacking a confident or skillful response.
